description:
What's coming in Python 3.8? You can learn it by yourself by reading an
excellent document [What's New in Python 3.8][1]. I'm not going to
retell this document. Instead I'll focus on things barely described
there or not mentioned at all:

-  Why will the new features appear in Python 3.8 and what's the story
   behind them?
-  What is being discussed and developed now, but won't appear in Python
   3.8?

I'll share the news I learned at PyCon 2019 from the talks and
discussions with Python core developers. I'll mention the following
topics:

-  New syntax: ``x := expr``, ``f(..., /, ...)``, ``f'{expr=}'``
-  New types: ``Literal``, ``Final``, ``TypedDict``
-  Future features of typing and async/await
-  New approaches to optimizing Python: sub-interpreters, mypyc
title: The Story of Features Coming in Python 3.8 and Beyond
